item.description:
The Yale school of music is kind of enough to treat the New Haven community to free concerts now and then, and I do mean treat! The last one I caught was terrific, and its exciting to see so many people turn out to pay homage to the great classics. They're so good, however, that the seats fill up fast, so even though the concert starts at 8, I think we'll try to meet there at 7:30 and grab seats no later than 7:45.
Here is their mailer:

"Light of Light"
YALE SCHOLA CANTORUM

Stephen Layton conducts English choral masterpieces. Yale Schola Cantorum, Simon Carrington, director and soloists from the Yale Voxtet, James Taylor, adviser. Music of Britten, Byrd, and MacMillan.

where:
St. Mary's Church
5 Hillhouse Ave., New Haven

when:
January 19 @ 8 pm

price: Free

Come on out and hear some great music! See you there!
-Neil
203-645-2008
nkindlon@gmail.com
item.name: free concert: Yale school of music choral masterpieces
